column3: Foley Johnson Meritage Rutherford
column7:
Bordeaux-like, offering an expansive mix of currant, cedar, cigar box, riverbed
and tobacco leaf flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit V erdot, Malbec and
Cabernet Franc. Best from 2020 through 2032. 1,429 cases made. —JL

column3: Cleto Chiarli e Figli Lambrusco di Sorbara del Fondatore
column7:
A well-knit rosé Lambrusco, featuring a fine, lively mousse and a bright mix of
crushed raspberry, crunchy peach, dried thyme and rose petal notes, with a
tangy finish of citrus zest and spice. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases
made. —AN

column3: Loring Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
column7:
Powerful, focused and well-spiced, with flavors of dark cherry, plum tart and
dried beef that lengthen out nicely. Pastry notes linger midpalate, leading to a
finish of cola nut and chocolate nib accents. Drink now through 2022. 900
cases made. —KM

column3: Drouhin Oregon Roserock Chardonnay Eola-Amity Hills
column7:
Polished and refined, with expressive apple, ripe cantaloupe and spice flavors
that take on richness on the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,866 cases
made. —TF

column3: Tabarrini Montefalco Sagrantino Colle alle Macchie
column7:
There's a pleasing creaminess to the intense tannins of this harmonious, fullbodied red, offering crushed cassis and black raspberry fruit that shows
accents of lavender and rosemary, with licorice, espresso and loamy earth
notes. An iron fist in a velvet glove, this should unfurl beautifully with age. Best
from 2020 through 2035. 175 cases made. —AN

column3: Ghost Pines Pinot Noir Yolo-Sonoma-Monterey Counties Winemaker's Blend
column7:
Complex and spicy, offering wild plum, blackberry, spice and tea flavors that
show subtle herb shadings, ending with dusty, loamy tannins and good length.
Drink now through 2023. 13,000 cases made. —JL

column3: Matervini Malbec Luján de Cuyo Finca Perdriel
column7:
Big, rich and full-bodied, with inky accents to the ripe dark plum, cherry and
blackberry flavors. Black licorice notes show midpalate, with mocha and dark
chocolate details on the dense finish. Drink now through 2022. 336 cases
made. —KM

column3: Carol Shelton Rosé Wild Thing Rendezvous Mendocino County
column7:
A spirited California rosé, with lively raspberry, cherry and spice flavors that
dance along the finish. Carignane, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink
now. 1,616 cases made. —TF

column3: Sadie Family Skerpioen Swartland
column7:
Intense and still youthfully tight, with verbena and white peach notes leading
the way for yellow apple, chamomile, white ginger and jasmine flavors. A lovely
quinine streak is well-embedded, giving this tension and vibrancy through the
finish. Chenin Blanc and Palomino. Drink now through 2024. 406 cases made.
—JM

column3: Ridge Lytton Springs Dry Creek Valley
column7:
Briary and subtly potent, with floral black raspberry and licorice aromas and
zesty, well-built dark cherry, smoky anise and pepper flavors that finish with
ripe tannins. Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignane and Mourvèdre. Best from 2019
through 2024. 9,750 cases made. —TF

column3: Domaine St.-Préfert Châteauneuf-du-Pape Auguste Favier Réserve
column7:
This is beautifully rendered, with a core of focused red currant, plum and
raspberry coulis flavors that stretches out nicely while flecks of tobacco,
bergamot and singed sandalwood weave around. A bolt of iron detail shows
through the finish, with a light echo of worn leather. Well-built, showing ample
energy in reserve. Best from 2020 through 2040. 1,400 cases made. —JM

column3: Lucienne Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
column7:
Rich and layered, with plump, juicy wild berry, raspberry, blackberry jam and
cedar flavors. A full and complete style that touches all the bases. Drink now
through 2025. 777 cases made. —JL

column3: Paolo Scavino Barolo
column7:
This starts out with plenty of cherry, plum and orange peel flavors, offset by
iron, eucalyptus and tobacco accents. The finish is rustic, with the tannins
flexing their muscles, yet this comes together in the end. A wine for the long
haul. Best from 2023 through 2040. 2,500 cases made. —BS

column3: Golan Heights Winery Cabernet Sauvignon Galilee Yarden
column7:
A sinewy, full-bodied red, with balsamic acidity gliding through the black olive,
currant and eucalyptus flavors. Spice, mineral and leather details gain traction
into the long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. K osher.
Drink now through 2023. 23,486 cases made. —GS

column3: Massican Annia Napa Valley
column7:
A complex and inviting white, showing intricate nuances of roasted almond,
matcha, honeysuckle and orange zest, mingling with supple, juicy Asian pear,
tangerine and ripe melon notes. The smooth texture and a thread of acidity
add to the appeal. Ribolla Gialla, T ocai Friulano and Chardonnay. Drink now.
1,128 cases made. —MW

column3: Sleight of Hand Syrah Columbia Valley Levitation
column7:
Polished and expressive, with blackberry, smoky sweet anise and cracked
pepper flavors that take on richness toward refined tannins. Drink now through
2024. 750 cases made. —TF

column3: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou St.-Julien
column7:
Showy, with layers of warmed fig, roasted mesquite, black tea, incense and
Turkish coffee notes, followed by waves of lush cassis, blackberry and
raspberry confiture flavors. This has a graphite grounding rod, a tarry spine
and riveting licorice snap details to keep it driving along. A head-turner for
sure. Best from 2025 through 2045. 7,500 cases made. —JM

column3: HW Wine Company Languedoc Rosé Diving Into Hampton Water
column7:
A nicely crafted rosé, with a hint of creamy richness lining the strawberry,
melon and white cherry flavors. A dash of minerality imparts depth through
the long, mouthwatering finish. A crowd-pleaser. Grenache, Cinsault,
Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now. 35,000 cases made. —GS

column3: Pendulum Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
column7:
Sleek and well-defined, with expressive black cherry and savory spice flavors
that finish with polished tannins. Drink now through 2023. 11,500 cases made.
—TF

column3: Librandi Val di Neto White Critone
column7:
Fresh and floral, with lime blossom, kiwifruit, peach and blood orange sorbet
flavors, this medium-bodied white is backed by vibrant acidity and lingers with
spice and graphite accents. Chardonnay with Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now
through 2021. 30,000 cases made. —AN

column3: Beringer Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
column7:
Firm, rich and tightly focused on a core of vivid dark berry, light mocha and
cedar flavors, finishing long and layered. A real treat. Drink now through 2026.
85,000 cases made. —JL

column3: Henri Gouges Nuits-St.-Georges Clos des Porrets St.-Georges
column7:
This red combines flavors of cherry, currant, spice and mineral with a core of
sweet fruit, a silky texture and firm, chalky tannins. Finishes on the chewy side,
with mouthcoating but not astringent tannins. Best from 2023 through 2040.
400 cases imported. —BS

column3: Landmark Chardonnay Sonoma County Overlook
column7:
Well-built and rich, with a solid core of apple pastry, fig and guava flavors that
offer a creamy texture. Nutmeg and clove notes show on the spicy finish. Drink
now through 2022. 30,000 cases made. —KM

column3: A. Clape Cornas
column7:
This has it all, from the dark, dense core of steeped fig, blackberry and black
currant fruit to the smoldering charcoal, dark olive and singed bay leaf notes.
Violet and white pepper nuances add lift before a prodigious warm cast-iron
element provides spine on the finish. A brick house that will live for quite some
time. Best from 2025 through 2045. 230 cases imported. —JM

column3: La Stoppa Emilia Trebbiolo
column7:
A pure beam of juicy black currant is underscored by woodsy spice, licorice
and tea rose notes in this bright and appealing, medium-bodied red, with light
tannins. Barbera and Bonarda. Drink now through 2023. 2,216 cases made. —
AN

column3: Schloss Gobelsburg Grüner Veltliner Kamptal
column7:
An aromatic style, boasting lilac and freesia accents. Apple and grapefruit
notes prevail as this elegant white winds down on the graceful finish. Drink
now through 2023. 3,700 cases imported. —BS

column3: Big Table Farm Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
column7:
Effortlessly elegant and complex, with vibrant rose petal, savory smoke and
raspberry accents that glide along a silky texture toward the long finish. Drink
now through 2024. 1,835 cases made. —TF

column3: Prà Soave Classico Otto
column7:
A lively, lithe white, with lovely lime blossom, pink grapefruit sorbet, stone and
spice notes that linger on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2022.
22,500 cases made. —AN

column3: Casa Ferreirinha Douro White Papa Figos
column7:
Aromatic, with notes of beeswax and almond flanking the lemon curd, pureed
mango and peach flavors of this medium- to full-bodied white. Spice, herb and
mineral details cascade into the long, creamy finish. Drink now through 2019.
20,000 cases made. —GS

column3: Odette Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
column7:
Beautifully crafted, rich and polished, with a dense core of dark berry, mocha,
cedar, crushed rock and licorice flavors, combining power and finesse in an
impressive showing. Drink now through 2034. 2,324 cases made. — JL

column3: Concha y Toro Carmenère Peumo Serie Riberas Gran Reserva
column7:
This boasts richly spiced aromas, with flavors to match, as well as dried
raspberry, portobello mushroom and currant elements. Dried beef notes on
the powerful finish. Drink now through 2021. 33,000 cases made. — KM

column3: Bookwalter Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Readers
column7:
Polished yet appealingly brawny, with floral black cherry, toasted spice and
bittersweet chocolate flavors that take on momentum toward refined tannins.
Drink now through 2026. 3,405 cases made. —TF

column3: Louis Jadot Bourgogne
column7:
Infused with graphite and cherry aromas and flavors, this red is expressive and
silky, with a good underlying structure for balance. Drink now through 2023.
35,000 cases imported. —BS

column3: Tiefenbrunner Pinot Grigio Vigneti delle Dolomiti
column7:
This balanced, light-bodied white offers a lively mix of peach, passion fruit,
floral and pink grapefruit zest notes, with tangy acidity and a floral finish. Drink
now through 2021. 25,800 cases made. —AN

column3: Peter Lauer Riesling Qualitätswein Feinherb Mosel Barrel X
column7:
A lithe white, showing fine clarity and focus, with orange blossom aromas
followed by kumquat and nectarine notes on the palate. Off-dry, offering
ample acidity for balance, with a mineral-infused finish. Drink now through
2020. 1,000 cases imported. —AZ

column3: Bodega El Esteco Malbec Calchaquí Valley Don David Reserve
column7:
Dried red fruit flavors are lively, offering a surplus of rich, dried savory herb
notes. Accents of hot stone and white pepper flood the finish. Drink now
through 2023. 110,000 cases made. —KM

column3: Terra Santa Île de Beauté White
column7:
A bright and distinctive white, offering lively lemon zest, honeysuckle, quinine
and tangerine notes mixed together, with good zip. Drink now. 22,000 cases
made. —JM

column3: Château Gloria St.-Julien
column7:
Well-steeped plum, fig and boysenberry fruit is richly layered, supported by
embedded brambly grip and backed by waves of ganache and sweet tobacco
on the finish. This has plenty of energy to carry it in the cellar while it rounds
into form. Best from 2023 through 2038. 18,333 cases made. — JM

column3: Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc California
column7:
Juicy pear, peach and citrus flavors are bright and smooth, with a touch of
dried chamomile and lemon verbena lingering on the finish. Impressive for the
focus and aromatic detail. Drink now. 96,700 cases made. — MW

column3: Merlin Mâcon-La Roche Vineuse
column7:
Complex, exhibiting saline and mineral elements, along with white peach,
apple and spice flavors. Beautifully balanced and focused, remaining intense
and long on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2024. 500 cases imported. — BS

column3: Fontodi Chianti Classico Vigna del Sorbo Gran Selezione
column7:
This is concentrated and monolithic, with blackberry and black cherry flavors
augmented by tar, tobacco and iron notes. Offers excellent potential, but
needs time to absorb the tannins. Powerful, showing fine length. Best from
2023 through 2040. 1,800 cases made. —BS

column2: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia
column3: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia Rioja White Viña Gravonia Crianza
column7:
Rich and firm, this white shows complex flavors of dried apple, creamed pear,
heather, white tea, coconut and vanilla. Juicy acidity and light tannins keep this
focused, providing structure for the long haul. A lovely example of the
traditional style. Drink now through 2026. 1,791 cases made. — TM

column3: Vasse Felix Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Filius
column7:
Opens with a fresh green accent reminiscent of tomato leaf and sage, giving a
savory, peppery note to the plush, velvety cassis and plum core. Finds balance
between grace and power, with spice and herb elements lingering on the
finish. Drink now through 2028. 800 cases imported. —MW

column3: Hamilton Russell Chardonnay Hemel-en-Aarde Valley
column7:
Melon, yellow apple, white peach and quince flavors give this an opulent feel,
harnessed by honeysuckle and quinine accents through the finish, showing
refinement and length in the end. Drink now through 2021. 2,100 cases
imported. —JM

column3: Yalumba Viognier South Australia The Y Series
column7:
Lemon, chamomile and spicy nectarine flavors are fresh and vibrant, set on a
crisp body, finishing spicy and refreshing, with plenty of intensity. Drink now.
19,000 cases imported. —MW

column3: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot St.-Emilion
column7:
This brims with ripe, juicy plum, blackberry and açaí berry flavors, studded with
licorice and fruitcake notes and backed by a nicely integrated apple wood
detail through the finish. Pumps a lot of fruit out but does so energetically.
Best from 2020 through 2035. 6,250 cases made. —JM

column3: Terre del Barolo Barolo Undicicomuni Arnaldo Rivera
column7:
The sweet fruit and solid structure play off each other as this evolves. Starts
with floral, cherry, strawberry and licorice flavors, melding into the firm,
resonant tannins as the finish extends. Complex, balanced and set for a long
life. Best from 2022 through 2036. 4,150 cases made. — BS

column3: Sequoia Grove Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
column7:
Rich, smoky oak and plump dark berry, mocha, cedar and sage flavors form an
enticing mouthful, supported by a supple, caressing texture, ending long and
full. Drink now through 2030. 18,106 cases made. —JL

column3: Domaine des Baumard Quarts de Chaume
column7:
Waves of creamed Jonagold apple, Cavaillon melon, mirabelle plum, mango
and white peach flavors provide thrilling range, while flashes of honeysuckle
and verbena add detail and focus throughout. Unctuous yet pure, sweet yet
invigorating, with an inner brightness that matches the outward hedonism.
Best from 2020 through 2045. 100 cases imported. —JM

column3: Radikon Venezia-Giulia Slatnik S Label
column7:
Like walking through a Turkish bazaar, this wafts spice and citrus notes that
pull you into the glass, while vibrant, lightly zesty acidity and light tannins form
a firm, well-knit frame for the spiced range of glazed apricot, kumquat, spun
honey, rose and mint flavors. Long and intriguing. Chardonnay and Friulano.
Drink now through 2030. 400 cases made. —AN

column3: The Four Graces Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
column7:
An expressive and supple version, with a complex core of lively tannins and
acidity, plus accents of black cherry, cinnamon and spice that linger toward the
minerally finish. Drink now through 2024. 14,140 cases made. —TF

column3: Domaine Gerovassiliou Malagousia Epanomi Single Vineyard
column7:
A lovely nose of floral and citrus notes leads to expressive flavors of ruby red
grapefruit granita and ripe yellow peach in this well-cut, light- to mediumbodied white. Lithe and lingering on the minerally finish. Drink now through
2023. 6,700 cases made. —AN

column3: Nigl Grüner Veltliner Niederösterreich Freiheit
column7:
Grass and pine aromas and flavors predominate, with peach, grapefruit and
floral notes underneath. Fine balance and persistence here, ending with
mouthwatering notes of peach, flowers and mineral. Drink now through 2024.
1,000 cases imported. —BS

column3: Edetària Garnatxa Blanca Terra Alta Via Terra
column7:
This white has a thick texture, delivering pear, guava, tarragon and blanched
almond flavors. Firm acidity and a touch of tannins give this a solid frame.
Muscular, but remains balanced. Drink now through 2023. 5,000 cases made.
—TM

column3: Henri Bourgeois Sancerre Les Baronnes
column7:
Lively, with bright lemon curd, gooseberry, thyme and lime pith notes. The
bright finish has mouthwatering cut thanks to a light chalky echo. Drink now
through 2021. 7,000 cases made. —JM

column3: Easton Zinfandel Amador County
column7:
Epitomizes fine Sierra Foothills Zinfandel, offering vibrant, briary raspberry,
smoked pepper and wild sweet anise flavors that stretch out on the zesty
finish. Drink now through 2023. 6,200 cases made. —TF

column3: Nik Weis St.-Urbans-Hof Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel From Old Vines
column7:
A pure, well-sculpted, off-dry version, with persimmon, lime and slate flavors
coating the palate. Hints of orchard blossom and herbs add to the complexity,
making you reach for another sip. Drink now through 2024. 7,000 cases made.
—AZ

column3: Milbrandt Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
column7:
Precise and well-built, with refined black cherry and black tea flavors that build
dimension toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2024. 4,000 cases
made. —TF

column3: Loveblock Pinot Noir Central Otago
column7:
Rich and creamy, with clove-scented notes of black cherry, plum and licorice
that are vibrant and expressive, while intriguing details of forest floor and fresh
herb linger, adding another dimension. Shows terrific harmony on the finish.
Drink now through 2028. 7,000 cases made. —MW

column3: San Román Bodegas y Viñedos Toro
column7:
A velvety texture carries ripe fruit flavors of plum and blackberry in this plush
red. Cocoa, loamy earth and mineral notes add depth and interest. Ripe
tannins are well-integrated, and balsamic acidity keeps this lively. Drink now
through 2029. 8,000 cases made. —TM

column3: Cline Zinfandel Contra Costa County Ancient Vines
column7:
Lively and supple, with floral raspberry and fresh pepper aromas and sleekly
appealing cherry and licorice flavors that glide lightly along the finish. Drink
now through 2022. 50,000 cases made. —TF

column3: Patricia Green Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
column7:
Shows structure and sleek polish, with expressive raspberry and rose petal
aromas and layered red plum, black tea and spice flavors that linger toward
refined tannins. Drink now through 2024. 2,917 cases made. — TF

column3: Leeuwin Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series
column7:
Supple and creamy up front, with precision to the nutmeg, lemon curd,
verbena and mandarin orange flavors, which are intense and harmonious. The
elegant body and lingering accents of ginger and citrus zest elevate this white
to something special. Drink now through 2028. 800 cases imported. — MW

column3: Bodegas Hidalgo La Gitana Manzanilla Sanlúcar de Barrameda La Gitana
column7:
A bright, high-pitched style, showing tangy quinine and chamomile notes
laced with talc and fleur de sel flavors. V ery dry, brisk, stony-edged finish. An
absolute delight. Drink now. 62,000 cases made. —JM

column3: Ferrari-Carano Chardonnay Russian River Valley Tré Terre Vineyard Select Collection
column7:
Strikes a fine balance between vibrant citrus and green apple and pear notes.
Lightly oaky and creamy midpalate, this is deftly elegant and refined. Drink
now through 2022. 5,400 cases made. —JL

column3: Descendientes de J. Palacios Bierzo Pétalos
column7:
This savory red offers notes of espresso, black olive and graphite framing a
core of black cherry and licorice. Fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity keep
this balanced. Harmonious and graceful. Drink now through 2024. 27,000 cases
made. —TM

column3: Lingua Franca Chardonnay Willamette Valley Bunker Hill
column7:
Sleek and seamlessly complex, featuring expressive floral lemongrass and
steely mineral aromas and plush yet refined green apple and lemon flavors
accented by spicy lees. Drink now through 2022. 692 cases made. —TF

column3: Château Branaire-Ducru St.-Julien
column7:
This pumps lush fig, boysenberry and blackberry confiture notes along, pushed
by a rather polished but ample structure. Lots of anise and violet details
cascade in on the finish, giving this extra aromatic dimension. Best from 2020
through 2038. 15,000 cases made. —JM

column3: Nautilus Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
column7:
Rich and complex, with honeysuckle and freshly grated ginger notes up front,
giving way to juicy and crisp Meyer lemon, yellow apple and Asian pear flavors.
Hints of lime zest and dried mango linger. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.
—MW

column3: Domaine Giraud Châteauneuf-du-Pape
column7:
Enticing, with bright, engaging raspberry, cherry and red currant fruit infused
with gently roasted sandalwood and apple wood, garrigueand licorice root
notes. A swath of tobacco underscores the finish, giving this an old-school
hint. Best from 2020 through 2040. 2,500 cases made. —JM

column3: DeLille Syrah Yakima Valley Signature
column7:
Polished and gracefully complex, with refined blackberry, espresso and smoked
pepper flavors that glide along toward refined tannins. Drink now through
2025. 700 cases made. —TF

column3: Bodegas Breca Garnacha Aragón Old Vines
column7:
Round, smooth and dense, this red shows harmony and balance. Plum and
blackberry flavors mingle with black olive, toast and mineral notes, supported
by well-integrated tannins and fresh acidity, leaving a lovely floral finish. Drink
now through 2027. 20,000 cases made. —TM

column3: Penley Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Phoenix
column7:
Dense, with sink-your-teeth-into-them tannins and concentration to the plum,
cassis and blackberry flavors. Sage and rosemary accents linger in the
background. Strikes the right balance between power and elegance, with grace
notes of eucalyptus, black tea and tobacco lingering on the velvety finish.
Drink now through 2030. 4,300 cases imported. —MW

column3: Roederer Estate Brut Anderson Valley
column7:
Seamless and silky, showing an almost effortless sense of complexity, with
notes of lemon and pear paired with toasty brioche, fresh ginger and hazelnut
details. Drink now. 80,000 cases made. —TF

column3: Bodegas y Viñedos Valderiz Ribera del Duero
column7:
Rich and focused, this red delivers ripe fruit flavors of currant and blackberry
that mingle with espresso, mineral and licorice notes. The firm tannins are wellintegrated and crisp acidity keeps this focused. Concentrated and harmonious.
Drink now through 2030. 2,500 cases made. —TM

column3: Tensley Syrah Santa Barbara County Colson Canyon Vineyard
column7:
A distinctive red, with power, polish and structure, offering floral blueberry and
garriguearomas and dynamic huckleberry, river stone and smoky meat flavors
that take on momentum toward the refined tannins. Drink now through 2028.
1,900 cases made. —TF

column3: Antinori Toscana Tignanello
column7:
Dense and intensely flavored, with violet, black currant, blackberry, graphite,
wild herb and spice aromas and flavors, this is concentrated and solidly built,
yet also harmonious, vibrant and pure. Approachable now, but should be
better in a few years. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc.
Best from 2021 through 2035. 5,000 cases imported. —BS

column3: Taylor Fladgate Vintage Port
column7:
This is packed with raspberry, blackberry and blueberry fruit flavors that play
off one another, melding with anise, fruitcake and ganache notes. A warm tarry
edge coats the finish, revealing an echo of bramble. A seriously grippy,
strapping Port, this revels in its power. Best from 2032 through 2055. 6,200
cases made. —JM

column3: Vik Milla Cala Cachapoal Valley
column7:
Rich and refined, delivering unctuous dark fruit and spice flavors that offer a
creamy svelteness. Slate and mineral accents linger on the complex finish, with
dark chocolate and olive notes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère, Cabernet
Franc, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2022. 4,000 cases made. —KM

column3: Scott Base Pinot Noir Central Otago
column7:
Smooth, silky raspberry coulis and maraschino cherry notes are impressive for
their purity, with accents of white chocolate, thyme, red licorice and cedar.
Spicy cigar box accents emerge on the long, expressive and detailed finish.
Drink now through 2028. 5,000 cases made. —MW

column3: Jasper Hill Shiraz Heathcote Georgia's Paddock
column7:
Fragrant notes of dried rose petal and white truffle indicate something special.
Inside, this offers a fleshy, velvety mix of toasted rye bread, spicy plum jam and
framboise flavors. Elegant and plush, but with plenty of power within, flexing
on the expressive, expansive finish that goes on and on. Drink now through
2035. 1,500 cases made. —MW

column3: San Felice Chianti Classico
column7:
Expressive and smooth, this hits all the right notes, with pure black cherry,
black currant and violet flavors. T ouches of earth, iron and tobacco add
complexity. Shows fine harmony and length. Best from 2020 through 2036.
25,000 cases made. —BS

column3: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape
column7:
A stunner from the get-go, with waves of thoroughly seductive boysenberry,
plum, blueberry and raspberry reduction forming the core, while roasted apple
wood, rooibos tea, bergamot, and anise notes flash throughout. This has
plenty of bass, with a Turkish coffee accent and a hint of alder driving
underneath. Everything moves in lockstep through the seriously long finish.
Best from 2020 through 2045. 12,500 cases made. —JM

column3: Caparzo Brunello di Montalcino
column7:
This cuts more of a broad swath than its peers, yet remains graceful, evoking
strawberry, cherry, tobacco and stony mineral flavors. Long and dense in
structure, with a tobacco- and underbrush-tinged finish. Best from 2021
through 2033. 15,000 cases made. —BS

column3: Château Monbousquet St.-Emilion
column7:
A rich, expressive, slightly showy style, with waves of cassis, creamed raspberry
and boysenberry fruit racing forth, backed by a polished yet ample structure.
The long, licorice- and ganache-framed finish packs on weight as it moves
along, yet stays defined and pure. Impressive. Best from 2022 through 2040.
9,333 cases made. —JM

column3: Canalicchio di Sopra Brunello di Montalcino
column7:
Plump and bursting with cherry, strawberry and mineral aromas and flavors,
this racy red evokes harmony and freshness, with hints of spice, chocolate and
tobacco as it plays out gracefully on the long aftertaste. There's structure here,
with all the components integrated. Best from 2020 through 2035. 2,870 cases
made. —BS

column3: Warre Vintage Port
column7:
Gorgeous, with warm plum reduction and gently steeped raspberry, blackberry
and boysenberry fruit flavors forming the core, all inlaid with warm ganache
and smoldering tobacco accents. Very plush in feel, but has no lack of energy,
as everything sails beautifully through the long finish. A late echo of anise
completes the seduction. Best from 2035 through 2055. 3,000 cases made. —
JM

column3: Produttori del Barbaresco Barbaresco Rabajà Riserva
column7:
This fruity version features floral, cherry and plum flavors, along with savory
leather, licorice and tobacco notes. A chewy texture and lively acidity keep this
well-defined through the long finish. Complex and classy. Best from 2023
through 2038. 1,420 cases made. —BS

column3: Felton Road Pinot Noir Central Otago Bannockburn
column7:
Elegant, fresh and vibrant, this red starts off wonderfully perfumed, with
lavender, white pepper and green tea notes that accentuate the purity of the
cherry and raspberry flavors. Polished tannins still provide some grip on the
finish, where white truffle and forest floor details linger. Drink now through
2032. 7,120 cases made. —MW

column3: Carpineto Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
column7:
The stunning bouquet of ripe black cherry, black currant, leather and woodsy
spice notes is enticing, while the sweet fruit is a match for the dense structure.
The lengthy finish lingers, with tobacco, eucalyptus and iron accents. Drink
now through 2030. 12,200 cases made. —BS

column3: Bedrock The Bedrock Heritage Sonoma Valley
column7:
A knockout red, focused and well-built but loaded with personality, with
expressive blackberry and dark Asian spice notes leading to intense yet refined
smoky plum, orange zest and cracked pepper flavors. Zinfandel, Carignane,
Mataro, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now through 2027. 600 cases
made. —TF

column3: Tenuta delle Terre Nere Etna San Lorenzo
column7:
Ripe black cherry and raspberry fruit meets tarry mineral and accents of
licorice, spiced orange peel and herb in this chewy, medium-bodied red. The
bold flavor and structure are deftly knit into a graceful and harmonious
package, with the spice and mineral character lingering on the finish. Best from
2020 through 2030. 750 cases made. —AN

column3: Le Vieux Donjon Châteauneuf-du-Pape
column7:
This offers a blitz of bay leaf and juniper notes out front, followed by a racy
and tightly coiled core of red and black currant, damson plum and cherry fruit
flavors. Lots of brisk iron and garrigueaccents rifle through the finish. Clear,
precise and streamlined, this should age wonderfully. Best from 2020 through
2040. 7,000 cases made. —JM

column3: Colene Clemens Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Dopp Creek
column7:
Impressive for the polished texture and elegant complexity, offering vibrant
raspberry, orange peel and spice flavors that gain momentum toward refined
tannins. Drink now through 2023. 3,023 cases made. — TF

column3: Aubert Chardonnay Carneros Larry Hyde & Sons
column7:
V oluptuous and creamy, with densely packed flavors of apple pastry, pear tart
and peach and hints of mango that are long and rich. The plush, complex
finish is filled with notes of spice and dried herbs. Drink now through 2026.
960 cases made. —KM

column3: Moët & Chandon Brut Champagne Dom Pérignon Legacy Edition
column7:
There's power to this graceful Champagne, with the vivid acidity swathed in a
fine, creamy mousse and flavors of toasted brioche, kumquat, pastry cream,
candied ginger and poached plum that dance across the palate. An
underpinning of smoky mineral gains momentum on the lasting finish. Drink
now through 2033. —AN

column3: La Rioja Alta Rioja 890 Gran Reserva Selección Especial
column7:
Cedar and sandalwood aromas give way to flavors of tea, tobacco, dried
cherry, forest floor and orange peel in this expressive red. Round on the palate,
supported by muscular tannins and juicy acidity. Big but graceful, mature yet
lively, in the traditional style. Drink now through 2030. 4,753 cases made. — TM

column3: Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva
column7:
Though saturated with black currant and blackberry fruit and backed by
opaque tannins, this red is pure and balanced. Thyme, iron, leather and tar
notes give this complexity, while the finish goes into overtime. Best from 2023
through 2040. 2,500 cases imported. —BS

column3: Château Canon-La Gaffelière St.-Emilion
column7:
Still youthfully tight and backward, with a well-roasted frame of alder and
juniper holding sway for now, but the core of cassis, blackberry and plum fruit
waits in reserve, showing prodigious depth. When the toast and fruit melds,
the backdrop of tobacco, singed iron and chalky minerality will get a turn to
show. There's a lot here. Built for the cellar. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and
Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2025 through 2040. 6,250 cases made. —JM

column3: Tenuta San Guido Bolgheri-Sassicaia Sassicaia
column7:
Rich and concentrated, this red features black currant, blackberry, violet,
mineral and spice flavors. Dense yet lively, structured yet impeccably balanced,
with vibrant acidity driving the long, fruit-filled aftertaste. The oak is beautifully
integrated. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2023 through
2042. 17,200 cases made. —BS
